meanings.sent1: The douane was where all the packages from other countries were checked.
meanings.sent2: I had to declare my items at the douane before entering the country.
meanings.sent3: The douane officer jokingly asked if I was smuggling in any surprises.
meanings.sent4: The douane stood like a guardian at the border, ensuring all goods were accounted for.
meanings.sent5: The douane's red roof made it easily recognizable from afar.

meanings.definition: The duties or taxes imposed on imported or exported goods
meanings.sent1: The douane on luxury items was quite high, making them expensive to import.
meanings.sent2: Importers had to factor in the douane when calculating their costs.
meanings.sent3: I grumbled about the douane as I paid the extra fees for my parcel.
meanings.sent4: The douane seemed like a toll gate for goods passing through borders.
meanings.sent5: The douane's fees were like a toll booth on the trade route.
